results.title: Infectious diseases and natural body defenses
results.brief_description: Uses photomicrography, laboratory demonstration, and animation to illustrate the two groups of natural body defences which guard the body against disease. Explains the outer body defences including the skin, passages of the nose and throat, and stomach acids. Among the inner body defences are lymph glands, the chemical antibodies, spleen, liver and while blood cells.

results.title: Infant development in the kibbutz (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines infant behaviour under the kibbutz system of shared parental and group care. Shows activities of the “baby house” where babies ranging from newborn to 21 months old are cared for while their parents are at work.

results.title: Infant dance (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Wolverhampton Education Committee
results.brief_description: A class of 6-7 year olds is observed performing spontaneous dance movements, movements inspired by suggestions from the teacher, and by short rhythms played on percussion instruments. Individual children are studied in closer detail.

results.title: Inertial mass
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Stephen White and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Edward M. Purcell demonstrates that acceleration is inversely proportional to mass with force constant and that different objects may have the same inertial mass. Compares inertial and gravitational mass and shows how they are proportional. A continuation of the film “Inertia”.

results.title: Inertia
results.creator_credit: Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Edward M. Purcell demonstrates Galileo’s principle of inertia in experiments with a body moving horizontally with minimal friction and using low friction dry-ice pucks and multiple flash photography showing acceleration is proportional to force when mass is constant. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Industrious flame
results.creator_credit: John Miller, Frank Green, Ace Films and British Gas Council
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that heat is essential in practically all industries to process raw materials. States that gas is one of the most economical sources of heat and shows its use in the pottery, steel sheet, baking and electric globes industries.

results.title: Industrial weight lifter
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct method of lifting heavy objects. A flexible model simulating the human backbone is used to illustrate how discs are “pinched” when weights are lifted while the backbone is curved. Good posture, positioning, and smooth application of lifting power are shown. Demonstrations point out that using the powerful leg muscles with the back straight and vertical increases lifting power. Extremely heavy items can only be handled with a special lifting device.
results.description: Demonstrates the correct method of lifting heavy objects. results.title: Industrial preparation of acetic acid (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Describes the process of making acetic acid, by the oxidation of naphtha with air, in a large industrial chemicals factory. Outlines the various stages in developing the process, including laboratory research and pilot plant development.

results.title: Industrial Mysore. Series 2
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A further report on Mysore and its products, including carvings in sandalwood and ivory, inlay work, sugar, paper from bamboo pulp, textiles and soap. Work in the Kojar goldfields is shown in some detail.
